2000: Usually, when girls are around 11 to 14,
2800: their bodies begin to change as the puberty* starts.
3600: *Puberty: the time when the body begins to develop
4400: and change as you move from a child to adult.
5800: One of those changes are having a period.
6400: During the period, the blood comes out of your body for a few days (around 3-7 days). So, you might be scared of it.
7000: But, don’t be afraid! This is a natural sign that your body is normally functioning as well as that you are healthy.
8000: There are different organs in body.
8800: These organs have each different roles.
9600: One of the organs in a woman’s body called ‘uterus’ is a place where a baby grows.
10400: Each ovary is placed on both sides of uterus.
11200: When the puberty starts, either side of the ovaries release fully grown egg, and release them once a month.
12000: Both ovaries take turns releasing eggs.
15800: When the egg is fully grown, it moves to the uterus through the fallopian tube*.
16400: We call the process of egg moving as the ‘ovulation.’
17000: After the ovulation, the egg might meet the sperm at the uterus. It is 'fertilized,' which is the first step of a pregnancy
17600: *Fertilization: The process that egg from the ovaries and sperm meets and starts to develop into a new baby.
18200: If it is not fertilized, the lining of the uterus (inner uterine wall) naturally falls off, because the old lining is not good for health.
19200: The fallen lining of the uterus bleeds and blood comes out through the tube ‘vagina’*.
20200: This whole process is what we call a ‘period (or menstruation).’
